#1- PIC unable to demonstrate knowledge to maintain adequate food safety, several high risk factors found at time of inspection, does not have certified food protection manager certificate. A person in charge shall demonstrate food safety knowledge and perform duties to maintain active managerial control for food establishment. Correction: Enroll/register for CFPM course within 2 weeks.
#16- Improper cooling of TCS foods, cooked noodles in bags (covered) in cold hold at 55 Degrees F - 60 Degrees F, tofu at 90 Degrees F - 95 Degrees F, cooling on MFUs not permitted. Correction: Repeat red violation, MFU shall obtain a commissary (to continue to prep food ahead of time) or submit adequate documentation within two weeks, by reinspection stating that MFU will cease cooling on truck PIC discarded noodles and tofu.
#17- Improper hot holding of steamed rice, 1 bag in instapot at 90 Degrees F - 93 Degrees F. All TCS foods shall be kept hot at or above 135 Degrees F. Correction: PIC discarded rice, discussed not bagging rice to ensure foods maintain 135 Degrees F or above.
#19- Room temperature storage of sauteed onions at 70 Degrees F - 74 Degrees F. unless approved by health department, foods requiring temperature control shall be kept either kept at or below 41 Degrees F or above 135 Degrees F. Correction: PIC discarded onions.
#26- Noncompliance with permit, MFU cooking with raw shelled eggs. As stated in the 2002 approval letter, the MFU was permitted w/out commissary with the conditions that no raw animal proteins are used and foods would be cooked to order. Correction: Cease using raw shelled eggs (suggest pasteurized eggs) and cease prepping food menu items ahead of time (tofu, noodles) or obtain commissary.
#34- Sanitizer concentration inadequate, 0PPM chlorine. In-use chlorine sanitizer shall be around 100PPM. Correction: PIC remade sanitizer, 50PPM.
#37- In-use utensils improperly stored, either on counter at room temp or in room temp water. In-use utensils shall be changed every 4 hours or under temp control (on ice at 41 Degrees or below) Correction: PIC will begin placing utensils under temp control.
#41- Sanitizer test strips absent at time of inspection. Test strips shall be available and used to ensure proper concentration. Correction: Obtain test strips.

1. PIC unknowledgeable, not performing duties to maintain AMC, unknown requirements (burger cook temps, warewashing, handwashing, barrier use), no CFPM. Correction: PIC to be knowledgeable and maintain AMC. See WAC 246-215 PG 17-19 for knowledge and duties of PIC. Register for CFPM by 7/9/25 (DOH CFPM handout and TCO PIC handout provided)

4. Improper handwashing. Employee handled raw beef with gloved hands, removed glove from one hand and re-gloved that hand, no handwashing occurred. Correction: Prevent potential contamination. Properly wash hands when required as required. Wash hands when tasks change at an approved hand sink with soap and warm water for 20 seconds minimum. Change gloves and wash hands when going from raw proteins (chicken, burger, etc.) to ready to eat foods. CDI- washed hands, changed gloves.

14. Raw whole shell eggs stored above ready to eat foods (produce not cooked) in main refrigerator. Correction: Prevent potential contamination from raw eggs. Store raw eggs below ready to eat foods.

21. Improper cold holding of TCS foods in grill prep unit, main refrigerator and one front prep unit above 41 Deg F. Correction: Maintain TCS in cold holding at or below 41 Deg F. Take internal food temperatures in each cold holding unit daily Ensure unit capacities do not exceed daily ability to maintain cold holding temps and allow for proper air flow. Daily logs required to be submitted 7/3 and 7/10.

27. Non-compliance with variance. Log sheet not maintained as required, absent. Correction: maintain daily log sheet as required or propose servicing schedule or install 3-comp sink. Future violations may result in re-inspection, servicing contract, 3-comp install, revocation of variance or other public measure.

29. Inadequate equipment for temperature control. Main unit volume exceeds unit capacities, inadequate cooling space, low air circulation. Correction: Cease cooling practices. Ensure foods being cold held are meeting temperature requirements. Notes: To reinstate cooling activities, propose method for proper cooling or menu alternatives or process change or other options. Approval of new equipment required in advance.

33. Potential contamination during storage. Containers of TCS foods double stacked on top of prep table TCS food inserts, bottom of container contacting food. Ice machine dirty with mold-like substance. Correction: Prevent potential contamination during storage. Maintain ice machine interior clean, cease double stocking.

42. Potential contamination during preparation, meat slicer dirty with visible debris. Correction: prevent potential contamination, ensure slicer is thoroughly cleaned. PIC to verify with some frequency. Recommend provided brush to aid in cleaning efforts.

- WAC 246-215
- Food recondition/ destruction guidance
- Temp logs
